intro: Himantoglossum affine, commonly known as the narrow-leaved helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its pleated, lance-shaped leaves and distinctive, hooded flowers that are typically greenish-yellow with purple veins. Native to Europe and parts of western Asia, it thrives in woodland and grassland habitats. The plant is known for its ability to grow in shaded environments and has a long flowering period from late spring to early summer. It is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
